items.sentence: I wish I could explain to you how important this is to me.
I wonder whether Tom has ever asked Mary why she did that.
I\'ll send you a copy of that picture as soon as possible.
I\'m afraid we must go if we want to get home before dark.
I\'m meeting Tom for lunch at a restaurant on Park Street.
I\'m not interested in learning how to fix a broken table.
I\'m very interested in listening to what you have to say.
I\'ve already written everything that needs to be written.
I don\'t care what anyone says. I think Tom is a nice guy.
I don\'t have time to do everything that needs to be done.
I don\'t have time to say this twice, so listen carefully.
I don\'t know what Tom told you, but it might not be true.
I don\'t really want to wear a tie to work, but I have to.
I don\'t think Tom knows what time I woke up this morning.
You\'re one of the most interesting people I\'ve ever met.
Tom didn\'t want to go outside without his hat and gloves.
Tom has gone to get a haircut, but he should be back soon.
Tom played the oboe and Mary accompanied him on the piano.
Tom ran and ran, until at last he saw the telephone booth.
Tom worked in the garden for several hours this afternoon.
